CONJUGATES: labels (n. plural) | labels (v. 3rd person singular present) | labeling/labelling (v. present participle) | labeled/labelled (v. past tense, past participle)
ETYMOLOGY: From Old French 'label' (a strip, ribbon), from Frankish '*lappō' (rag, strip).

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A noun is a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, things, or ideas.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A small piece of paper, fabric, plastic, or similar material attached to an object, giving information about it. It can also refer to a classificatory name or phrase applied to a person or thing.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 贴在物品上的小纸片、布料、塑料或其他材料，提供有关该物品的信息；或指对人或事物进行分类的名称或短语。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The product has a clear label indicating its ingredients. It's unfair to put a label on someone based on one mistake.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 该产品有清晰的标签标明其成分。仅仅因为一个错误就给某人贴标签是不公平的。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A verb is a word used to describe an action, state, or occurrence.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To attach a label to an object; to assign to a category or describe with a particular term.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 在物品上贴标签；将某物归类或用特定术语描述。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Please label all the boxes with their contents. Critics often label his work as avant-garde.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 请在所有箱子上贴上内容标签。评论家经常把他的作品贴上先锋派的标签。
